author: Scott Adam Gordon
title: Google Assistant may soon help you make online purchases
text:
Google Assistant may soon be able to help you carry out transactions, a teardown of a recent Google App APK file has revealed. XDA inspected the Google App beta version 6.11.13 and discovered it contained a number of strings relating to Assistant payment settings, including content regarding billing and delivery addresses.
Google Home , Google’s voice-activated speaker powered by Assistant, already helps users with some transactions — like ordering an Uber or booking movie tickets through Fandango — but it’s speculated that the upcoming Google Assistant payment functionality would allow it to also be used for online shopping.
See also: Google Assistant update adds ability to take screenshots 6 days ago XDA indicates that you’ll be able to “Specify which Assistant-connected devices will be able to participate in making payments,” and notes an app string that says: “You’ll soon be able to pay for things,” suggesting that Google may tease the service soon.
Meanwhile, Amazon’s Echo devices, powered by its Alexa software, already support voice payments, though it’s not a perfect system .
